## Context

- Insee maintains a [**register of localized buildings**]{.orange} (RIL)
  - Comprehensive housing data for cities with over 10k inhabitants 🏙️
  - Used to create [**sampling frames**]{.blue2} for census surveys 📋
- The RIL quality is [**good**]{.orange} in metropolitan France ✅...
  - ...but France also includes [**overseas territories**]{.blue2} (OTs)! 🌎
  - There, data [**quality is significantly lower**]{.blue2} ⚠️

## Census in Overseas Territories

- A [**cartographic survey**]{.orange} is conducted in OTs before each census

- [**Critical context**]{.orange}, particularly in Mayotte and French Guiana:
  - Local authorities [**question official statistics**]{.blue2}
  - Rapid [**urban development**]{.blue2}
  - Difficult [**field conditions**]{.blue2}

- Requires significant [**work**]{.orange} and is highly [**costly**]{.orange} 💰

- Can we use [**satellite imagery**]{.orange} to optimize census processes in OTs? 🛰️

::: {.notes}

- [**Satellite data as supporting evidence**]{.orange}:
  - Independent information source 🔍
  - Continuous territorial monitoring 🔄
  - Transparent and reproducible methodology 📑

:::

## Our use cases

- [**Pre-cartographic survey**]{.orange}:
  - Identify [**priority areas**]{.blue2} for fieldwork 🎯
  - Detect [**building changes**]{.blue2} since last survey 🏗️
  - Perform [**temporal comparisons**]{.blue2} using historical and recent imagery 📆

- [**Post-cartographic survey**]{.orange}:
  - [**Automated change detection**]{.blue2} 🤖
  - Analysis of [**land-use evolution**]{.blue2} 🌳➡️🏘️
  - Assist [**population estimates**]{.blue2} in OTs 📊

- [**Extraordinary use case**]{.red2}: Rapid response after devastating tropical cyclone "Chido"
